title: 1. Who oversees Consent Managers — is it only the Data Protection Board, or also the government?
description: Consent Managers are registered and regulated by the Data Protection Board of India. The Board checks whether they meet technical, financial, and organizational requirements before granting registration (Schedule I).

previous.title: 6. What happens if a Data Fiduciary fails to comply — does liability sit only with the company, or can directors and officers also be held responsible?

next.title: 2. How do Consent Managers earn revenue if their role must remain neutral?
